executiveSummary: Justin Wang, founder of Larq, pitched his self-cleaning, UV-C powered water bottle to the Sharks, asking for $500,000 for 1% equity—the highest valuation ever requested on Shark Tank. After negotiations, he accepted a joint offer from Kevin O’Leary and Lori Greiner for $1 million total investment in exchange for 4% equity, maintaining valuation integrity while gaining two strategic partners.
keyDecisions: Justin Wang accepted a $1 million investment from Kevin O’Leary and Lori Greiner for 4% equity, declining offers with advisory share contingencies.

actionItems.task: Finalize investment structure and equity transfer with Kevin O’Leary and Lori Greiner
Coordinate marketing and distribution opportunities, potentially through QVC and other channels

nextSteps: Larq will proceed with finalizing the Shark Tank deal terms and begin collaboration with Kevin and Lori to expand product visibility and sales channels.
